availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Coyle, Sr. (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Pennsylvania native. Married to Margaret Lynch Coyle. Father of George Coyle, Thomas Coyle, and Margaret J. Coyle. Farmer in Bath County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned four enslaved persons in Bath County in 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Owned seven enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, District 1, p. 58A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, Wyoming, p. 283.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 11.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath County, p. 75A.
Kentucky Death Certificates, 1911-1965, Kentucky Office of Vital Statistics, KDLA, Frankfort, KY, File 2180.
"George Coyle (1792-1892)," Find A Grave, Memorial 93054030, accessed September 26, 2022, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/93054030.
